pageContext.claim: “Just a little bit more than a month ago, we set every record you could set: more people working than we've ever had working before -- almost 160 million; the best unemployment numbers we've ever had; and the best employment numbers we've ever had. Everybody was doing well. Stock market at a record -- 142 days it hit a record.”
pageContext.analysis: The unemployment rate did not reach record lows under Trump, despite his repeated claims to the contrary, and the stock market -- although it was doing well -- did not notch 142 daily records. It's not surprising that more people would have been working than ever before; it is a function of a population that keeps growing.
